questions.question_text: A company would like to move all its on-premises platforms to the cloud. The company has enough skilled Linux and web-server engineers but only a couple of skilled database administrators. It also has little expertise in managing email services. Which of the following solutions would best match the skill sets of available personnel?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Explanation:
This option optimally balances the company's available skill sets and reduces management overhead where expertise is lacking:

✔ Web Servers in IaaS → The company has skilled Linux and web-server engineers, so they can manage web servers in Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) with full control.

✔ Databases in PaaS → The company has few skilled database administrators, so Platform as a Service (PaaS) will handle database maintenance, backups, scaling, and security, reducing the need for DB expertise.

✔ Email in SaaS → Since the company has little expertise in managing email, Software as a Service (SaaS) (like Microsoft 365 or Google Workspace) will offload email management completely.

A. is correct. I though DBs were only support through dBaas, Iaas, and Paas but it seems it supported through SaaS as well. It would be nice to know what kind database and capabilities they needed from the DB but since it is generalized to everything it's A.

questions.question_text: A systems administrator is deploying a new version of a website. The website is deployed in the cloud using a VM cluster. The administrator must then deploy the new version into one VM first. After a period of time, if there are no issues detected, a second VM will be updated. This process must continue until all the VMs are updated. Which of the following upgrade methods is being implemented?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Explanation:
A rolling update gradually updates instances in a cluster one by one (or in small batches) while keeping the application running. This ensures minimal downtime and allows the administrator to monitor the new version for issues before updating the next instance.

✔ Step-by-step process:

Update one VM.
Monitor for issues.
If stable, update another VM.
Repeat until all VMs are updated.

When migrating customer financial information from a private cloud to a public cloud, security and access control are the top priorities.

✔ ACL (Access Control List) ensures only authorized users can access, modify, or transfer sensitive financial data.
✔ Automated validation & verification can be applied through ACL rules to prevent unauthorized disclosure.
✔ Granular permissions help restrict access based on user roles, IP addresses, and application requests.

A. ACL (Access Control List)

Explanation:

ACL (Access Control List): ACLs can be configured to specify which users or system processes are granted access to objects and what operations are allowed on given objects. By using ACLs, the cloud engineer can set permissions and ensure that only authorized users can access the financial information during and after the migration, thus preventing unauthorized disclosure.
